intro: Echium × bramwellii, commonly known as the hybrid fleabane, is a flowering plant native to the Mediterranean region. It is a member of the Boraginaceae family and is characterized by its striking blue or purple flowers that bloom in summer. The plant typically grows to a height of 30–60 cm and has hairy, lance-shaped leaves. It thrives in well-drained soils and full sun, making it a popular choice for rock gardens and coastal landscapes. Echium × bramwellii is also valued for its ability to attract pollinators such as bees and butterflies.
